defitem.label: Athletics Facilities
defitem.item: See Boat and Crew Houses, Field House, Gymnasium and subheadings.

defitem.label: Burnham School Properties
defitem.item: Consult This, The House We Live In [entries for Burnham School and Hampshire House] and see Eleanor Duckett House, Hampshire House, Mary Ellen Chase House, Parsons House Annex (19 Round Hill Road), and Tilly Hall.

defitem.label: Capen School Properties
defitem.item: Consult This, the House We Live In [entries for Capen Annex, Capen House, and Capen School] and see Capen House, Capen House Annex, Davis Student Center, Gill Hall, Parsons House, Parsons House Annex (25 Henshaw Avenue), and Talbot House.

defitem.label: Demolished Buildings
defitem.item: Consult Appendix F of this finding aid.

defitem.label: Invitation Houses
defitem.item: See Delta Sigma Invitation House and White Lodge. (List may not be exhaustive.)

defitem.label: Language Houses
defitem.item: See Bedford Terrace # 8 (French and German), Dawes House (French), German House, Washburn House (Spanish), and West Street # 75 (French).

defitem.label: Libraries
defitem.item: See Libraries and subheadings.

defitem.label: Music and Performing Arts Facilities
defitem.item: See Center for the Performing Arts, Libraries-Werner Josten Performing Arts Library, Pierce Hall, Sage Hall, and Students' Building.

defitem.label: Religious Centers / Facilities
defitem.item: See Chapel and subheadings.

defitem.label: Science Facilities
defitem.item: See Burton Hall, Geology Building (Never Built), Engineering Building, Libraries-Sabin-Reed Science Library, Libraries-Young Science Library, Lilly Hall, Lyman Plant House, Observatory, Science Center [includes Bass Hall, Clark Science Center, and Proposed Science Center], and Stoddard Hall.

defitem.label: Student Centers
defitem.item: See Campus Center, Davis Student Center, Prospect Street #10 [Student Clubhouse], and Students' Building. Consult Smith College construction website http://www.smith.edu/construction/ for current campus center updates (as of March 2002).

odd.head: Appendices
odd.p: This finding aid has nine appendices. These represent the only item-level cataloguing in the finding aid. "See also" notes are used within the box list when an appendix should be consulted.

label.ref: Appendix A-Friends of the Library Event Keepsakes

defitem.item: Lists and describes print and artifact "keepsakes" commissioned by the Friends of the Library for various events. 1978-present. Keepsakes found in 22. Libraries-Friends of the Library-Events-Keepsakes, Box 55.

label.ref: Appendix B-Smith College Museum of Art Exhibit Posters

defitem.item: Lists oversize exhibit posters from SCMA exhibits. 1961-present. Other exhibit information can be found in Museum of Art-Exhibits, Boxes 87-94.
Lists the bookplates found in 22. Libraries-Bookplates, Box 53.
Lists all buildings for which the Archives has student registers or rosters and the years for which these records exist.

Lists buildings which have related objects in the Artifacts Collection. A numbered list of all building-related artifacts is also part of this appendix, so the nature of the artifact may be determined without having to request it.
Lists all Smith buildings that have been demolished by the College.
Lists the street address (if applicable) for some extant and demolished buildings.
Lists all buildings with material in oversize boxes or flat-file drawers, gives nature of material and location.

defitem.label: Appendix I-Notes
defitem.item: During the processing of the collection, it has been necessary on occasion to add a note of clarification or explanation to a file-either because something in the file contents themselves was not clear, or because a certain processing decision warranted explanation. Copies of these are appended to the finding aid.

note.p: Arranged Chronologically by Date of Occasion

odd.head: Exhibit Posters from the Smith College Museum of Art

note.p: Arranged Chronologically by Start Date of Exhibit
All posters are in Flat File Drawer 9.

list.item: Diderot & the Salon des Beaux Arts [oversized brochure] April 8 - 30 1961
Renaissance Bronzes in American Collections April 9 - May 3 1964
Willem de Kooning: A Retrospective Exhibition From Public and Private Collections [oversized brochure] April 8 - May 2 1965
Photographs by Clarence Kennedy April 28 - June 5 1967
Berenice Abbott, Helen Frankenthaler, Tatyana Grosman, Louise Nevelson January 17 - February 24 1974
Roman Baroque Sculpture (in conjunction with the Five-College Roman Baroque Festival) April 4 - 28 1974
Rodin's Balzac: Sculptures from the Cantor, Fitzgerald Collection September 20 - October 27 1974
Video as an Art From: An Anthology of Videotapes 1969 - 1974 December 3 - 8 1974
Prints and Drawings Acquired by the Smith College Museum of Art During the Curatorship of Elizabeth Mongan 1969 - 1975 April 24 - ? 1975
The Peep Show: Victorian Optical Toys November 21 1975 - January 25 1976
Works by Senior Studio Art Majors May 22 - October 3 1976
Francisco Goya: Los Caprichos y Los Disparates November 11 1977 - January 7 1978
Photographs by Living Americans: Recent Acquisitions Purchased with the Aid of Funds from the National Endowment for the Arts in Washington, D.C., a Federal Agency December 1 1977 - February 5 1978
Tibetan Buddhist Art from the Horch Collection, Rose Art Museum, Brandeis University December 1 1977 - January 15 1978
Antiquity in the Renaissance (In honor of Phyllis Williams Lehmann) April 6 - June 6 1978
A Changing Exhibition of The Gift of Priscilla Paine Van der Poel April 28 - October 1 1978
Shakespeare and Company: Sculpture by Michael de Lisio; Books from the Smith College Library Rare Book Room March 6 - April 13 1980
The Vanston Collection: English Drama of the 17th and 18th Centuries April 3 - May 31 1981
The Catherine Atwater Galbraith Collection of Indian Paintings April 16 - November 1 1981
Speaking a New Classicism: American Architecture Now April 30 - July 12 1981
Elizabeth Murray: Recent Pastels and Prints April 3 - 16 1982
Caught in the Act: An Exhibition Based on the Studies of Eadweard Muybridge May 18 - October 24 1982
Barry Moser's Wood Engravings and Drawings for Lewis Carroll's Alice's Adventures in Wonderland & Through the Looking Glass and What Alice Found There December 9 1982 - February 27 1983
Time, Technology, Taste & Travel: An Exhibition of 19th Century Photographs February 17 - March 27 1983
In Memoriam Jere Abbott 1897 - 1982; Director of the Smith College Museum of Art 1932 - 1946 April 30 - October 23 1983
A Family of Friends: Gifts to the Collection from the Lamont and Cunningham Families 1949 - 1983 May 12 - October 23 1983
Dorothy C. Miller: With an Eye to American Art April 19 - June 16 1985
Janet Fish: Recent Paintings and Pastels 1980 to 1985 April 8 - June 1 1986
Juxtapositions: The Art of Nancy Spero [symposium poster; accompanies exhibit To Soar II: Nancy Spero 1990] March 1 - May 20 1990

list.head: William Allan Neilson Library--Groups
list.item: Government of France--in Honor of 75th Anniversary of Smith College

list.head: A - B
list.item: Abbott, Herbert Vaughan and Senda Berenson

list.head: Miscellaneous
list.item: Indianapolis Smith Club--Bookplates for Indianapolis Public Library

note.p: The following buildings have artifacts you may be interested to view. Buildings are listed alphabetically; the numbers listed after each building link to the Artifacts Register.

list.head: Stoddard House
list.item: Purchased from the Stoddard Family in 1880, architect unknown
Used for student housing for a short time
Moved, then razed in 1919 for Chemistry Building (now Stoddard Hall)

list.head: 33 Elm Street (original Tenney Family house)
list.item: Razed in 1937 for Alumnae Association building. Tenney cooperative assigned to 156 Elm Street

list.head: Dickinson House
list.item: 8th Dormitory on campus, located south of Alumnae Gym between Hubbard and Lawrence
Named as a memorial for gifts from Samuel Dickinson and Philura Dickinson Hubbard, wife of Smith's first Treasurer, George W. Hubbard.

list.head: 79 and 91 Elm Street
list.item: Built c1866, William Fenno Pratt, architect
Owned by Northampton physicians, purchased in 1923 by Smith College.

list.head: 10 Prospect Street
list.item: Owned by Alexander McCallum, purchased by Smith College in 1929.

list.head: Wallace House
list.item: Razed August 1959 for Wright Hall. Site proved too small for Wright

list.head: Observatory
list.item: Built 1886, addition in 1898, William C. Brocklesby, architect
L. Clark Seelye and A. Lyman Williston, Trustee of College were donors
Demolished in Summer 1960 for Wright Hall construction

list.head: Student's Building aka, "Studes"
list.item: Students and alumnae raised the funds for construction
Razed June 1964 for Wright Hall construction

list.head: Hillyer Hall
list.item: Art Gallery was moved from 2nd floor of College Hall into Hillyer. 1887 a new addition to Hillyer was built
Demolished August 1970 for Fine Arts Center complex

list.head: Gateway
list.item: Built 1875 on original site of Dewey House, Peabody & Stearns, architects
1st Presidents House (1875-1920), then successively, Dean's Home, Doctor's Office, Warden's Home, various offices, School for Social Work
Named "Gateway" by Laura Scales, Warden, while she lived there (1924-1932)
Demolished August 1970 for Fine Arts Center complex

list.head: Graham Hall
list.item: Built in 1910, as an addition to Hillyer
Named after Christine Graham Long '10, donor
Demolished August 1970 for Fine Arts Center complex

list.head: Tryon Gallery
list.item: Built in 1926, Frederick L. Ackerman, architect
Named after Dwight Tryon, professor of Art (1886-1923), donor
Demolished August 1970 for Fine Arts Center complex

list.head: Dawes House (original) 18 Henshaw Ave
list.item: Built by David C. Rogers, inherited by Flora E. Quimby. Purchased by Smith College in 1926. Known as "La Maison Francaise" (french house)
Razed in 1972 for Friedman Houses dormitories

list.head: Oak House 10 Henshaw Ave
list.item: Built in 1890, architect unknown, for Pearson family, aka White House Inn
Purchased by Smith College in 1974 for student housing

list.head: Hopkins Houses A ("Quill") & B ("Owl's Nest")
list.item: Razed in June 1998 preparing for move of Wesley House and Campus Center construction

note.p: [originally compiled for Smith Alumnae Quarterly, June 1998, by different processor]
